memberdef.name: wxIMPLEMENT_CLASS_COMMON_TEMPLATE1
memberdef.initializer: template<> \ wxClassInfo name<T1>::ms_classInfo(wxT(#name "<" #T1 ">"), \ &basename::ms_classInfo, \ baseclsinfo2, \ (int) sizeof(name<T1>), \ (wxObjectConstructorFn) func); \ template<> \ wxClassInfo *name<T1>::GetClassInfo() const \ { return &name<T1>::ms_classInfo; }

memberdef.name: IMPLEMENT_DYNAMIC_CLASS_TEMPLATE1
memberdef.initializer: template<> \ wxObject* name<T1>::wxCreateObject() \ { return new name<T1>; } \ wxIMPLEMENT_CLASS_COMMON1_TEMPLATE1(name, basename, \ name<T1>::wxCreateObject, T1)

briefdescription.para: wx >= 2.9.0 uses its own template support

xrefdescription.para: Check out how wxWidgets 2.9 supports templates
